advice: Classic BMW 4-lug. Shares specs with VW 4-lug.
The standard BMW fitment. Fits almost all 5-lug BMWs except E39.
Unique hub bore. Requires hub rings to fit other BMW wheels, or boring out other wheels to fit E39.
Ubiquitous 4-lug pattern. Fits VW, Audi, older BMW, Honda (with rings), Miata (with rings).
Common on Mk4 VW and most Subarus. Subaru wheels fit VW with 1mm hub ring. VW wheels need boring for Subaru (rare).
Mercedes wheels fit VW/Audi with hub rings. VW/Audi wheels need boring to fit Mercedes.
Exclusive to Porsche (and Q7/Touareg). High offset usually required.
Volvo wheels fit Ford Focus/Fusion with rings. Ford wheels need boring for Volvo.
Ford Fox body and Peugeot/Citroen share the pattern but offsets are wildly different.
Honda wheels fit Mazda/Toyota with rings. Mazda/Toyota wheels need boring for Honda.
The most common 5-lug pattern. Ford/Mopar/Nissan/Toyota/Honda. Check hub bore! Ford/Mopar (70.5mm) wheels fit everything else with rings.
Toyota wheels fit GM with rings. GM wheels DO NOT fit Toyota (hub too small).
Metric 5x120. NOT the same as 5x120.65 (4.75). Do not mix.
Classic Chevy pattern. S10, Corvette, Camaro (Pre-2010).
FWD GM and modern Dodge Charger/Challenger. Very close to 5x114.3 but NOT interchangeable safely.
Oddball GM pattern. Malibu, Cobalt SS, Saab 9-3.
Jeep JK/JL and GM 1500 trucks (Pre-99) / SUVs.
Classic Ford truck and modern Ram 1500. Ford hub is huge.
Ford F-150 2004-Present. Unique to Ford.
Ford F-150 1997-2003. One generation only.
Ford Super Duty 1999+. Does not fit older 8x6.5 trucks.
Classic VW Beetle (Late).
Fiat/Alfa/Lancia. Can use 4x100 with wobble bolts (sketchy).
Older Nissan/Datsun 4-lug.
Dodge Viper and Dakota/Durango. Weird size.
Classic Land Rover Defender/Discovery 1.
Range Rover L322 (BMW Era) uses BMW wheels.
Classic Mini and Austin. Tiny wheels.
MGB, Triumph TR6.
Racing wheels. Single nut.
Check specific model.
